title: Four projects have cleared initial screening for Ofgem’s Electricity Network Innovation Competition
lead: Four projects have passed the initial screening for the Electricity Network Innovation Competition (NIC), with network operators seeking £29 million for green heat and flexibility.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EDF to close Dungeness B seven years early as the UK’s nuclear fleet dwindles
lead: EDF is to close its Dungeness B nuclear power station in Kent, seven years earlier than planned as the UK’s nuclear fleet continues to shrink.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: City of Edinburgh Council unveils new strategy to support 2030 net zero ambitions
lead: A strategic partnership between ​City of Edinburgh Council and SP Energy Networks has been formed as part of the former's new decarbonisation strategy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Heat batteries: The oft overlooked low-carbon heat solution and Caldera’s Warmstone offering
lead: Current± caught up with heat battery start-up Caldera founder and CEO James Macnaghten to discuss the economics of the technology, and the opportunity for the technology in the UK and beyond.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: E.ON aims to increase affordability with EV salary sacrifice scheme
lead: ​E.ON has launched an electric vehicle (EV) salary sacrifice scheme following its company car provision going all electric in 2019.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK could provide global decarbonisation blueprint to help build a 'credible path' to net zero
lead: The UK’s decarbonisation success could provide the world with a replicable blueprint, a new report from SSE and KPMG has argued, although there is still more work to do at home.
author: Alice Grundy

title: NewMotion seeks 'seamless' EV charging experience as it signs roaming agreement with Mer
lead: ​NewMotion is continuing to bulk out its roaming agreements with the announcement of its latest partnership with Statkraft-owned Mer.
author: Alice Grundy

title: REGO prices jump 50% higher than January as power prices head towards pre-pandemic levels
lead: ​Renewable Energy Guarantee of Origin (REGO) prices have jumped 50% higher than they were in January 2021, as market sentiment remains broadly positive.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: First Bus lays claim to UK's largest EV charging hub as it unveils depot electrification plans
lead: ​First Bus is transforming one of its depots into the UK’s largest EV charging hub with the installation of 162 150kW electric vehicle (EV) chargers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: DSR can reduce energy bills by 25% finds UK’s largest trial FLATLINE
lead: ​Domestic demand side response (DSR) can reduce bills by 25%, the UK’s largest trial has found.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: A third of UK businesses to install EV charging at employee's homes
lead: ​Increases in home working have influenced the electric vehicle (EV) charging plans of businesses, as 34% say they plan on putting chargers in employee’s homes.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Strong sales streak continues for BEVs with 441% jump
lead: ​Battery electric vehicles (BEVs) sales have once again seen a significant increase, with a jump of 441.3% recorded last month when compared to May 2020.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SPEN launches low-carbon modelling tool Heat-Up
lead: ​SP Energy Networks (SPEN) has unveiled a first of its kind tool for modelling the uptake of low-carbon forms of heat, dubbed ‘Heat-Up’.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSEN to utilise smart meters to respond to power interruptions
lead: ​Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (SSEN) is to use near real-time data from smart meters to respond to power interruptions.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Green energy sector supports 23,000 Scottish jobs
lead: ​Scotland’s green energy sector currently supports 22,660 jobs, according to new research that also found that renewables provide 97% of its electricity consumption.
author: Alice Grundy

title: World's largest domestic V2G trial finds hardware costs still too high despite 'significant financial rewards'
lead: ​Aggregated electric vehicles (EVs) participating in Dynamic Containment could earn consumers up to £725 a year, but hardware costs must reduce.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National flexibility vs. local: The benefits of moving away from a siloed approach
lead: Following the Carbon Trust's recent report, Current± caught up with the non-profit's director Andrew Lever to discuss the benefits of flexibility for the country as a whole.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: DCC to explore opening up its network to support EV charging in new Toshiba partnership
lead: ​Barriers to electric vehicle (EV) charging including security, interoperability and load management are to be tackled as part of a new consortium.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Mayor of London reveals raft of new measures to support ‘retrofit revolution’
lead: ​A new centre of excellence, a partnership to bring together social landlords and building firms and a new investment in the solar workforce have been unveiled today (2 June).
author: Alice Grundy

title: InstaVolt launches app to help ‘fight range anxiety’
lead: ​Rapid charging company InstaVolt has launched a new app to help combat range anxiety.
author: Molly Lempriere
